original: @82b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @82b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: tsitta gu hya gambh'i r'artha g'i ti n'a ma /
analyzed: tsitta gu hya gambh'i r'artha g'i ti n'a ma /
translated: CittaguhyagambhirarthƒÅrthagƒ´ti-nƒÅma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: sems kyi gsang ba zab don brda'i glur blangs pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: sems kyi gsang ba zab don brda'i glur blangs pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Secret of Mind: A Song of Symbolic Meaning of the Profound Truth

original: sha ba ri dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sha ba ri dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to ≈öavaripa!

original: kye ho chu dang 'o ma so sor nam mkha'i mthongs su bsres pa rtog med dang pa'i mchu des bsdus nas song //
analyzed: kye ho chu dang 'o ma so sor nam mkha'i mthongs su bsres pa rtog med dang pa'i mchu des bsdus nas song //
translated: Oh! The beak of a discerning swan gathers the milk and water separately in the sky.

original: 'dab chags 'ug pa'i mig gis sna tshogs mun pa'i khrod na snang ba so sor mthong ba phyi rol min //
analyzed: 'dab chags 'ug pa'i mig gis sna tshogs mun pa'i khrod na snang ba so sor mthong ba phyi rol min //
translated: The eyes of an owl, a bird, see the various appearances in the darkness separately, not externally.

original: 'dab chags ne tsos nyi ma'i 'od la rtsi shing nags khrod mthong la dga' zhing rtse la lhag par chags //
analyzed: 'dab chags ne tsos nyi ma'i 'od la rtsi shing nags khrod mthong la dga' zhing rtse la lhag par chags //
translated: A parrot, a bird, sees the light of the sun and delights in the forest of plants, and is especially attached to playing.

original: rma bya dug gi lo ma zos pas spu sdug lhag par mdzes pa'i kha dog mdongs ni su yis bris //
analyzed: rma bya dug gi lo ma zos pas spu sdug lhag par mdzes pa'i kha dog mdongs ni su yis bris //
translated: Who painted the beautiful colors of the peacock's feathers by its eating poisonous leaves?

original: sgeg mo bzhin gyi dri ma dag pa'i gdong can me long ba lta la rab tu brtson pa shes par gyis //
analyzed: sgeg mo bzhin gyi dri ma dag pa'i gdong can me long ba lta la rab tu brtson pa shes par gyis //
translated: Know that a beautiful woman, with a face clean of dirt, is diligent in looking at a mirror.

original: srin po'i gling las thar pa'i ded dpon dri za'i grong mthong de la gnas bcas don chen 'grub pa mtshar //
analyzed: srin po'i gling las thar pa'i ded dpon dri za'i grong mthong de la gnas bcas don chen 'grub pa mtshar //
translated: The captain, who had escaped from the island of the ogresses, saw the city of the Gandharvas, and, having settled there, accomplished his great purpose.

original: drang srong chu yi zla ba blta zhing nyi zla'i phreng ba bgreng la brtsen pa gtsang sbra lhag par che //
analyzed: drang srong chu yi zla ba blta zhing nyi zla'i phreng ba bgreng la brtsen pa gtsang sbra lhag par che //
translated: The sage, looking at the moon in the water, and playing with the garland of the sun and moon, was very pure.

original: rgyal pos dgra thabs kyis ni bkug ste bcings nas bsad pas srid dang bcas pa thob ste g-yon can min //
analyzed: rgyal pos dgra thabs kyis ni bkug ste bcings nas bsad pas srid dang bcas pa thob ste g-yon can min //
translated: The king, having summoned him by the stratagem of an enemy, bound him and killed him. He obtained sovereignty and was not a rogue.

original: ging pa srog gcod mkhas pa nyin bzhin srog gcod de la sdig pas mi gos gshin rje gshed //
analyzed: ging pa srog gcod mkhas pa nyin bzhin srog gcod de la sdig pas mi gos gshin rje gshed //
translated: The executioner, skilled in taking life, who daily took life, was not defiled by sin, like Yam√¢ntaka.

original: rdzi bo thabs mkhas lcags kyus stobs ldan glang po'i kha lo ji ltar 'dod bzhin bsgyur pa phyi rol min //
analyzed: rdzi bo thabs mkhas lcags kyus stobs ldan glang po'i kha lo ji ltar 'dod bzhin bsgyur pa phyi rol min //
translated: The cowherd, skilled in means, with his hook, controlled the powerful elephant as he wished, and was not an outsider.

original: mig 'phrul mkhan pos nyi zla brkus te mun khung nang du sbas pas gza' skar thams cad dbang du 'dus //
analyzed: mig 'phrul mkhan pos nyi zla brkus te mun khung nang du sbas pas gza' skar thams cad dbang du 'dus //
translated: The magician, having stolen the sun and moon, hid them in the darkness, and brought all the stars and planets under his control.

original: tshangs pa'i ril ba chus bkang mi 'dzag dag byed rgyud du 'chang ba shes na rten 'brel che ba yin //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i ril ba chus bkang mi 'dzag dag byed rgyud du 'chang ba shes na rten 'brel che ba yin //
translated: The Brahmans' water-pot, which never runs dry, is a great charm if one knows how to wear it.

original: dpyid dus me tog mgul chad lhung ba shing thog ro ldan 'gyur bar re ba'i mi de 'ja' tri yin //
analyzed: dpyid dus me tog mgul chad lhung ba shing thog ro ldan 'gyur bar re ba'i mi de 'ja' tri yin //
translated: The man who expects to find a good fruit in a flower-wreath which has fallen in spring is a Jatri.

original: rdza so ma btang snod der chu blugs mi 'dzag min pas me nang bcug la ti tsha mkhas par bya //
analyzed: rdza so ma btang snod der chu blugs mi 'dzag min pas me nang bcug la ti tsha mkhas par bya //
translated: The water which is poured into an unbaked earthen vessel does not remain there; put it on the fire and be skilful in boiling the tea.

original: khu rta skom yang sa nang 'bab pa'i chu ni mi 'thung nam mkha'i char rgyun 'dzed par shes par bya //
analyzed: khu rta skom yang sa nang 'bab pa'i chu ni mi 'thung nam mkha'i char rgyun 'dzed par shes par bya //
translated: The thirsty horse will not drink the water which falls on the ground; he knows how to bend his neck for the stream in the sky.

original: lkugs par sdod pa'i mi des khab len rdo yis lcags phye bsdus pas rgya mtsho ra zla ba gza' yis bzung //
analyzed: lkugs par sdod pa'i mi des khab len rdo yis lcags phye bsdus pas rgya mtsho ra zla ba gza' yis bzung //
translated: The man who remains dumb has collected the iron-dust with the help of the magnet. The moon is seized by Rahu.

original: dus mtha'i mdung rtser 'bab pa'i tshangs pa'i dngul chu de la gzugs mdzes brtan pa'i rgyal po lhag par dga' //
analyzed: dus mtha'i mdung rtser 'bab pa'i tshangs pa'i dngul chu de la gzugs mdzes brtan pa'i rgyal po lhag par dga' //
translated: The moon-water of the Brahmans, which falls on the point of the spear at the end of time, is especially dear to the king of the firm and beautiful forms.

original: zo chun 'khor los khron pa'i chu rnams gyen du drangs pas mchog gi lo tog smin pa ae ma ho //
analyzed: zo chun 'khor los khron pa'i chu rnams gyen du drangs pas mchog gi lo tog smin pa ae ma ho //
translated: The water of the well is drawn up by the water-wheel. Oh, the ripening of the supreme harvest!

original: zab mo @83a * //
analyzed: zab mo @83a * //
translated: ProfoundüîΩThe Secret Am·πõta: A Song of Symbols

original: brda'i glu gsang ba'i bdud rtsi zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: brda'i glu gsang ba'i bdud rtsi zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: is completed.

analyzed: // / sha ba ri dbang phyug gis dam pa la gsungs /
translated: ≈öavaripa taught it to Tilopa.
